paragraphs.content: Chapter 2
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 2

paragraphs.content: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

paragraphs.content: And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.

paragraphs.content: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

paragraphs.content: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

paragraphs.content: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.

paragraphs.content: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.

paragraphs.content: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.

paragraphs.content: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare it.

paragraphs.content: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,

paragraphs.content: And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now.

paragraphs.content: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

paragraphs.content: ¶ After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And the Jews’ passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And the Jews’ passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

paragraphs.content: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:

paragraphs.content: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables;

paragraphs.content: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house an house of merchandise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house an house of merchandise.

paragraphs.content: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?

paragraphs.content: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

paragraphs.content: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?

paragraphs.content: But he spake of the temple of his body.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But he spake of the temple of his body.

paragraphs.content: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.

paragraphs.content: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all men,
paragraphs.contentHtml: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all men,

paragraphs.content: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.
